summary: Robert J. Lehner is mentioned in the context of the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) final determination regarding the release of House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. Specifically, his payroll records were part of the documents reviewed by the ARRB. The ARRB postponed the release of certain information, such as Social Security numbers, from the HSCA's staff payroll records, including Lehner's, to protect personal privacy. The documents indicate that Lehner was an HSCA staff member, and his payroll information was subject to review and potential redaction before public release.
significance: Robert J. Lehner's significance in the JFK assassination context stems from his employment with the HSCA, which investigated the assassination. His payroll records, as part of the HSCA's staff records, were subject to review and potential redaction by the ARRB before public release, indicating his involvement, albeit indirectly, in the historical record related to the JFK assassination investigation.
